section.title: Special terms and assorted acronyms
section.para: TERESAH uses some specific terminology and technical words that you may or may not be familiar with. Here we will attempt to clarify things.

para.emphasis: Tools E-Registry for E-Social science, Arts and Humanities

listitem.para: Application Programming Interface - a defined way for programs to "speak" to each other.
A facette is a category that is used to sort different tools. Facets include (for example) the developer of the tool, or the platform it runs on.
In TERESAH, a tool refers to a specific piece of software (and its page in TERESAH) that might be useful to researchers.

section.title: Types of users
section.para: Different users have different rights in TERESAH. These are the types of user, and what rights they have.

listitem.para: User with registered account. Can edit own profile and create lists of tools. The "basic" type of user - all the other types of user "builds" on this type.
Authenticated user with collaborator status. Can add and edit tools and data types
Authenticated user with supervisor status. Can add, edit and remove tools, data types, data sources, list activities, and harvest other data sources.
Authenticated user with administrator status. Has full access to all administrative functions.
